title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: i have a [URL="http://www.everymac.com/systems/apple/macbook_pro/specs/macbook-pro-core-i7-2.4-17-late-2011-unibody-thunderbolt-specs.html"]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011[/URL]. the mac lags everywhere, in apple diagnostic, recovery, new drive, new drive plugged in via usb. nothing seams to stop the lag. i remember when i was training with louis he mentioned this issue could be caused by the board but i do not remember what he said it was caused by.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: Any errors when you run EFI version of ASD?

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: i ran the apple diag by holding down d and option, the only error that comes up is battery, wich we know wont charge and needs replaced

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: Bad battery can cause the slow-down issue, FYI.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: Yup, first replace battery. Also check if BIOS chip was ever messed with.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: if i unplug the battery will that let me test it? ive ran several mac books with out batteries and never had a lag issue

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: Some will, some wont. I've had some 2011/2012 15" models that DID experience slow-down/throttled issues without a battery installed, while some others didn't. I would test with a known-good (original Apple) battery, known-good (original Apple) 85W charger, and a known-good trackpad/cable.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro "Core i7" 2.4 17" Late 2011 lagging
message: sweet the battery was the problem, thanks for the heads up, i thought if i unplugged the battery it would rule out the battery as the problem.
